caption: Incident Finding
description:
An Incident Finding reports the creation, update, or closure of security incidents as a result of detections and/or analytics.
Note: Incident Finding implicitly includes the incident profile and it should be added to the metadata.profiles[] array.
name: incident_finding

activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the Incident activity.

1.caption: Create
1.description: Reports the creation of an Incident.

activity_name.description: The Incident activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CKÂ® objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques associated to the Incident.

comment.description: Additional user supplied details for updating or closing the incident.

desc.description: The short description of the Incident.

end_time.description: The time of the most recent event included in the incident.

src_url.description: A Url link used to access the original incident.

start_time.description: The time of the least recent event included in the incident.

status.description: The normalized status of the Incident normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the Incident.

1.caption: New
1.description: The service desk has received the incident but has not assigned it to an agent.

2.caption: In Progress
2.description: The incident has been assigned to an agent but has not been resolved. The agent is actively working with the user to diagnose and resolve the incident.

3.caption: On Hold
3.description: The incident requires some information or response from the user or from a third party.

4.caption: Resolved
4.description: The service desk has confirmed that the incident is resolved.

5.caption: Closed
5.description: The incident is resolved and no further action is necessary.
